intro: Persea nanchuanensis, commonly known as the Nanchuan persea, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to southern China, particularly in the provinces of Sichuan and Yunnan. The plant is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in humid, subtropical climates and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
